events.originalText: A suicide bombing in Mogadishu, Somalia, killed 25 people, including three ministers of the Transitional Federal Government.
events.subtitle: 2009 Hotel Shamo bombing
events.headline: Suicide bombing in Mogadishu kills 25, including three ministers

events.originalText: NASA lost contact with the Mars Polar Lander moments before it reached the atmosphere of Mars and disappeared.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA loses contact with Mars Polar Lander

events.originalText: Sony released the PlayStation, the first computer entertainment platform to ship 100 million units.
events.subtitle: Sony Interactive Entertainment
events.headline: Sony releases PlayStation, ships 100 million units

events.originalText: Mary Robinson was inaugurated as the first female President of Ireland.
events.subtitle: Mary Robinson
events.headline: Mary Robinson inaugurated as first female President of Ireland

events.originalText: Eleven people were crushed in a human stampede at a concert by British rock band The Who in Cincinnati, Ohio, U.S.
events.subtitle: The Who concert disaster
events.headline: Eleven crushed in stampede at The Who concert in Cincinnati

events.originalText: Following the result of a two-day referendum, the current Constitution of Iran was adopted.
events.subtitle: 1979 Iranian constitutional referendum
events.headline: Iran adopts current Constitution following referendum

events.originalText: Jamaican reggae musician Bob Marley survived an assassination attempt by seven gunmen in Kingston.
events.subtitle: Reggae
events.headline: Bob Marley survives assassination attempt in Kingston

events.originalText: American singer Elvis Presley's first television special and first live performance in seven years, Singer Presents ... Elvis, was broadcast by NBC.
events.subtitle: Elvis Presley
events.headline: Elvis Presley's first TV special broadcast by NBC

events.originalText: Cardiac surgeon Christiaan Barnard (pictured) performed the first successful human heart transplant on Louis Washkansky at Groote Schuur Hospital in Cape Town, South Africa.
events.subtitle: Cardiothoracic surgery
events.headline: Christiaan Barnard performs first successful human heart transplant

events.originalText: The current flag and coat of arms of Singapore was adopted, six months after the island became self-governing within the British Empire.
events.subtitle: Flag of Singapore
events.headline: Singapore adopts current flag and coat of arms

events.originalText: Putting Pants on Philip, the first official film featuring the comedy duo Laurel and Hardy, was released.
events.subtitle: Putting Pants on Philip
events.headline: First Laurel and Hardy film released

events.originalText: Freda Du Faur (pictured) became the first woman to climb Aoraki / Mount Cook, the highest peak in New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Freda Du Faur
events.headline: Freda Du Faur first woman to climb Mount Cook

events.originalText: Himalia, Jupiter's largest irregular moon, was discovered by Charles Dillon Perrine at the Lick Observatory in California.
events.subtitle: Himalia (moon)
events.headline: Himalia, Jupiter's largest irregular moon, discovered

events.originalText: War of the Second Coalition: French forces defeated Austrian and Bavarian troops at the Battle of Hohenlinden, eventually resulting in the Austrians signing the Treaty of Lunéville.
events.subtitle: War of the Second Coalition
events.headline: French forces defeat Austrians at Battle of Hohenlinden

events.originalText: During the First Mongol invasion of Burma, the fort at Ngasaunggyan was overrun after a two-month siege.
events.subtitle: First Mongol invasion of Burma
events.headline: Fort at Ngasaunggyan overrun during First Mongol invasion of Burma
